Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Added myself as a codeowner of the linker code." (#2444) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "Do not create override directory in Release builds" (#2445) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2053

Override directory is used only during development and, as such, is not created
by applications built in the `Release` configuration. The only exception to this
rule is when the release app is being profiled, in which case we do create the
override directory.

Recent migration to CMake for `src/monodroid` builds caused our release builds
of the XA runtime to not define the `RELEASE` macro and, in effect, the override
directory has always been created for release apps.

This commit rectifies it and makes the `src/monodroid` release
build **actually** work :)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Mono.Android-Tests and Xamarin.Forms-Performance-Integration should build against system instalation" (#2442) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/2153 added dependency on `_CreateJavaInteropDllConfigs` target, which only works inside the XA build.

I should make the target conditional, so that these tests are still possible to build outside of XA source tree.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "When set a style for an Android custom layout it didn't work, but in Android Studio it works fine" (#2156) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a blank Xamarin.Android project.

2. Create a style in `values\styles.xml`:
```
<resources>

  <style name="RelativeLayout2">
    <item name="android:layout_width">40dp</item>
    <item name="android:layout_height">300dp</item>
    <item name="android:background">#114499</item>
    <item name="android:padding">50dp</item>
  </style>

</resources>
```

3. Create a custom layout file:

```
namespace CustomeView
{
    public class RelativeLayout2 : RelativeLayout
    {
        public RelativeLayout2(Context context, IAttributeSet attributeSet)
            : base(context, attributeSet, 0, Resource.Style.RelativeLayout2)
        {
        }
    }
}
```
4. Use it in android `activity_main.axml` file:

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<InflationWithStyle.RelativeLayout2 
    xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
    xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent">

    <TextView
      android:layout_width="wrap_content"
      android:layout_height="wrap_content"
      android:text="An utter lack of style."/>

</InflationWithStyle.RelativeLayout2>
```

5. In `MainActivity.cs`:

```
    [Activity(Label = "@string/app_name", Theme = "@style/AppTheme", MainLauncher = true)]
    public class MainActivity : AppCompatActivity
    {
        protected override void OnCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        {
            base.OnCreate(savedInstanceState);
            // Set our view from the "main" layout resource
            SetContentView(Resource.Layout.activity_main);
        }
    }

```

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior (When use these code in Android Studio)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18043540/45212274-0fe98b80-b2c7-11e8-973e-32ed970d295c.png)

### Actual Behavior(When use these code in Visual Studio)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18043540/45212346-40c9c080-b2c7-11e8-8737-bd3602972058.png)

## Question:

Could you please tell me that why defStyleRes has no effect in custom View (RelativeLayout)?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Android.Telecom.InCallService SetAudioRoute(int route)" (#2437) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
In Mono.Android (v7.0) Android.Telecom.InCallService, the SetAudioRoute method is accepting an incorrect parameter, this receive `int route` instead of `VideoQuality route`. 

https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/f9a7cfc0da2f51b2c3006550fad2e25fbd23be5a/src/Mono.Android/methodmap.csv#L1898

[https://developer.android.com/reference/android/telecom/InCallService#setAudioRoute(int)](url)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin Forms iOS Previewer - no longer works after upgrading to Visual Studio 15.9.1" (#4462) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

Xamarin Forms iOS Previewer - no longer works after upgrading to Visual Studio 15.9.1

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Upgrade to VS 15.9.1 on Windows
2. Upgrade Xamarin.iOS on Mac to 12.2.1.10
3. Open Xamarin Forms Previewer

You can see the rendered form

### Actual Behavior
The iOS renderer requires an active connection to your Mac agent to function. Please re-connect to your Mac to enable this feature.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "AppLinks doesnt work on iOS" (#4478) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
I am using Deeplinking in iOS version 12.1 Simulartor ,app links does get created but ```OnAppLinkRequestReceived``` doesnt get hit 

Related links :
- [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/xamarin-forms/platform/deep-linking](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/xamarin-forms/platform/deep-linking)
- [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UJv4jUs7cJw](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UJv4jUs7cJw)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new project 
2. Add code to create App-links 
3. In simulator go to search view - enter the same URL
--or--
Open it from some other app , like - iMessages

4. Search bar should preview the App link but does not

I have not linked it with Azure but I think it should show as indexed URL 

### Expected Behavior
App links indexed should be shown on iOS 

### Actual Behavior
App links not shown

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE:
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android: <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP:  <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 --> 
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Moved common properties of Entry and Editor to base class InputView" (#4477) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Pull request #2038 added an `IsTextPredictionEnabled` property to the `Entry` class, and #4023 added the same property to the `Editor` class. This pull request moves this, and several other duplicated properties, to the shared base class `InputView`.

### Issues Resolved ### 

- N/A

### API Changes ###

Changed:
- Moved `Text` property, `IsTextPredictionEnabled` property, `Completed` event, `SendCompleted` method, `TextChanged` event, `OnTextChanged` method, `IPlaceholderElement` implementation, `ITextElement` implementation from `Entry` and `Editor` to `InputView`

### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->

- Core/XAML (all platforms)

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 

N/A

### Testing Procedure ###

N/A

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

### Description of Change ###

If `Device.Flags` is `null`, the code supposed to check for the presence of
the flags throws a `NullReferenceException`. Most users will get that
instead of the helpful version of it. Which is not very inclusive of the
people too lazy to read the docs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[codeowners] Add chamons to a few areas" (#5147) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened issue "NSUrlSession HttpResponseMessage.Headers.TryGetValues returns only one element for multiple cookies" (#5148) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Choose NSUrlSession HttpClient implementation in iOS project properties
2. Make a request with HttpClient to some site that sets mutliple different cookies
3. Execute TryGetValues with "Set-Cookie" header name on response message: [HttpResponseMessage.Headers.TryGetValues](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.http.headers.httpheaders.trygetvalues(v=vs.118).aspx)

### Expected Behavior
Should return (output) more than one entry for each cookie. This behavior is default for all other implementations: Android, Windows, Linux, iOS Managed HttpClient implementation etc.
### Actual Behavior
Returns (outputs) just one element that is concatenated string of multiple cookies

Events.RelatedBody:
[This](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/commit/f865694f86dca326a5721c1e0ba5795e7971d5e6) commit breaks running\debugging tests that use the new xibuild.

The root cause is that that we are add xibuild to the path in tests/Makefile with the incorrect assumption that it will affect all usages. The IDE does not inherit that setting.

```
System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception : ApplicationName='xibuild', CommandLine=' --  /verbosity:diagnostic  /property:XamarinMacFrameworkRoot=/Users/donblas/Programming/macios/master/xamarin-macios/_mac-build/Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.Mac.framework/Versions/Current /property:Configuration=Debug /Users/donblas/Programming/macios/master/xamarin-macios/tests/mmptest/bin/Debug/tmp-test-dir/Xamarin.MMP.Tests.MMPTests.RunMMPTest/MobileBinding.csproj', CurrentDirectory='', Native error= Cannot find the specified file
```

cc: @radical
